text: I absolutely loved the new restaurant downtown! The food was incredible and the service was outstanding.

label_suggestions.explanation: The text contains strongly positive words like 'loved', 'incredible', and 'outstanding'.

text: The movie was okay, nothing special. It had some good moments but also some slow parts.

label_suggestions.explanation: The text expresses mixed feelings with both positive and negative aspects.

text: I'm so frustrated with this product. It broke after just two weeks of use and customer support was unhelpful.

label_suggestions.explanation: The text shows frustration and disappointment with the product and service.

text: Just finished reading that book you recommended. What an amazing story! I couldn't put it down.

label_suggestions.explanation: Enthusiastic language ('amazing', 'couldn't put it down') indicates positive sentiment.

text: The weather today is cloudy with temperatures around 65 degrees Fahrenheit.

label_suggestions.explanation: This is a factual statement about weather without emotional content.

text: This is the worst experience I've ever had. I want a full refund immediately.

label_suggestions.explanation: Strong negative language ('worst experience') and demand for refund indicate dissatisfaction.

text: The conference was informative. I learned a few new things, though some sessions were repetitive.

label_suggestions.explanation: Mixed assessment with both positive (informative, learned) and negative (repetitive) elements.

text: Thank you so much for your help! You really made my day better.

label_suggestions.explanation: Gratitude and positive impact ('made my day better') show positive sentiment.
